reference.shortdesc: The defaultSubject element specifies the default value for the attribute in cases where no value is specified for the attribute. The default value must be one of the controlled values that are bound to the attribute.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: This he defaultSubject element is specialized from . It is defined in the map module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , (with a narrowed definition of href, given below), , keys, and keyref. This element also uses processing-role, locktitle, and toc from .

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample declares that each of the four defined "os" values is valid for the platform attribute. If no value is specified for the platform attribute in the DITA source, the default is "linux".
example.codeblock: <subjectScheme> <subjectdef keys="os"> <subjectdef keys="linux"/> <subjectdef keys="mswin"/> <subjectdef keys="zos"/> <subjectdef keys="macos"/> </subjectdef> <enumerationdef> <attributedef name="platform"/> <defaultSubject keyref="linux"/> <subjectdef keyref="os"/> </enumerationdef> </subjectScheme>
